faqs.question: What is B.Sc (Hons) Agriculture?
faqs.answer: B.Sc (Hons) Agriculture is a 4-year undergraduate program that provides comprehensive knowledge of agricultural sciences including agronomy, horticulture, soil science, plant pathology, and agricultural economics. The program is designed as per ICAR guidelines and focuses on both theoretical knowledge and practical skills required for modern agriculture.

faqs.question: What are the career opportunities after B.Sc (Hons) Agriculture?
faqs.answer: After completing B.Sc (Hons) Agriculture, graduates can work in government agricultural departments, research institutes, agribusiness companies, food processing industries, agricultural banking, and NGOs. They can also become agricultural consultants, farm managers, or start their own agribusiness ventures. Higher education options include M.Sc in Agriculture or MBA in Agribusiness Management.

faqs.question: Is practical training included in the program?
faqs.answer: Yes, the B.Sc (Hons) Agriculture program includes extensive practical training through laboratory work, field visits, internships, and hands-on experience in experimental farms and demonstration plots. Students get exposure to modern farming techniques, agricultural machinery, and latest agricultural technologies during their course.
